data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3600780,"name":"Pedro Lima","username":"Limao","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/4af34b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T00:36:45.366Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eIn the last years, the most part of \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eFRC\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"FIRST Robotics Competition\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e stores started selling their own Swerve Drive Modules, and with that much of options in the market, We got on doubt with which one to choose. Today, we are using the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eSDS\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Swerve Drive Specialties\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e mk4i module, but we got some trouble with the angulating belt, that always break when we put the Kraken X60 power over 70%. After visiting other teams on Champs, we noticed that each team uses a different module, so our doubt got ever bigger. Which Swerve Module should we buy to have the best performance with the drive train without have much problems?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T00:36:45.366Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":284,"readers_count":283,"score":90.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500223,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-drive-module-should-we-choose","display_username":"Pedro Lima","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62534,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600792,"name":"Andrew Card","username":"AndrewCard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/96bed5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T00:49:44.647Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWhile i have heard reports of belts breaking on MK4i modules, this is usually after an extreme amount of use. If you are breaking belts regularly something else might be up. That being said the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eWCP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"West Coast Products\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e X2 modules or the upcoming \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eSDS\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Swerve Drive Specialties\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e MK5 module have gear for the module steering.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn general changing from MK4i to a newer module is unlikely to impact robot performance substantially. Depending on how tight your budget is, money could easily be better invested elsewhere.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T00:49:44.647Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":262,"readers_count":261,"score":95.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500223,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-drive-module-should-we-choose","display_username":"Andrew Card","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60721,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6657 Mentor | FRCDesign.org"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600794,"name":"Samuel","username":"Copi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/copi/{size}/233489_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T00:52:02.776Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHaving the belt break that easily on MK4is sounds like extreme amounts of use or something else acting up. That being said, the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eWCP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"West Coast Products\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e X2 line only uses gears, and the upcoming \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eSDS\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Swerve Drive Specialties\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e Mk5 doesn’t either afaik. I don’t think upgrading swerve is worth it though unless you have a lot of money to throw at problems. MK4is are great, and have something of an upgrade path with the chassis lowering block and the mk4n kit. You can also look into printed swerve as an alternative to the billet wheels for a higher wheel CoF and much much easier swaps.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T00:52:02.776Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":244,"readers_count":243,"score":97.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500223,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-drive-module-should-we-choose","display_username":"Samuel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61799,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"strategymaxxing"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600806,"name":"Pedro Lima","username":"Limao","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/4af34b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T01:02:22.834Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003ewe really dont know what is happening with our mk4i swerve modules, we saw some teams on Champs that uses 100% Krakens to drive and to angulate, even teams that custom krakens to use 130% of its power, and none of them concerned about belts breaking. We don’t know if its about the drivetrain size, the robot weight or something else, but we broke around 3 or 4 belts, but we can’t find why it is broken, so we are considering to change our swerve module to one that doesn’t use belts.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T01:02:22.834Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":62.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500223,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-drive-module-should-we-choose","display_username":"Pedro Lima","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"username":"Copi","name":"Samuel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/copi/{size}/233489_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62534,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600863,"name":"Samuel","username":"Copi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/copi/{size}/233489_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T01:43:08.558Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eMaybe the belt isn’t seated properly or has debris, or potentially the pulley itself is misaligned or damaged, but that type of wear is still strange. Maybe a thorough inspection and breakdown of the swerve modules to make sure they’re installed correctly and are clean will fix the issue or at least tell you what it is, but it’s hard to say what it could be without taking a close look at the area in question.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T01:43:08.558Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":45.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":500223,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-drive-module-should-we-choose","display_username":"Samuel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"username":"Limao","name":"Pedro Lima","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/4af34b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61799,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"strategymaxxing"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600920,"name":"Daniel","username":"Daniel.Bloomfield","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T02:20:38.107Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThat interesting as my team never really saw any major issues with the mk4i’s (with krakens on the last 2). We drive the crap outta our swerves and there’s never been any major problems. Granted we’re really diligent about regular full cleans and inspections. Never really see any critical failures of any kind in the swerve itself.  The only thing I don’t really love about the mk4i’s is they’re annoying if you want a really small chassis.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T02:20:38.107Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":500223,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-drive-module-should-we-choose","display_username":"Daniel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"username":"Limao","name":"Pedro
